meanings.definition: To gratify or indulge (an immoral or distasteful desire or taste)
meanings.sent1: He pandered to his friend's unhealthy obsession with junk food.
meanings.sent2: The politician pandered to the crowd's desire for easy solutions.
meanings.sent3: The chef pandered to the diner's love for excessive amounts of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The company pandered to consumer greed with their misleading advertisements.
meanings.sent5: The artist pandered to shock value in their latest controversial piece.

meanings.definition: To act as a go-between in sexual intrigues
meanings.sent1: She pandered to the secret desires of the forbidden lovers.
meanings.sent2: The spy pandered to the rival agents to gather information.
meanings.sent3: The matchmaker pandered to the whims of the star-crossed lovers.
meanings.sent4: The gossip columnist pandered to the scandalous affairs of the celebrities.
meanings.sent5: The mediator pandered to the clandestine meetings of the undercover agents.

meanings.definition: To cater to the lower tastes and desires of others
meanings.sent1: The reality TV show pandered to the audience's love for drama.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid newspaper pandered to the public's appetite for gossip.
meanings.sent3: The fast-food chain pandered to the community's craving for unhealthy meals.
meanings.sent4: The website pandered to users' addiction to clickbait headlines.
meanings.sent5: The comedian pandered to the crowd's fondness for crude jokes.
